I am a PhD candidate in the History Department at Indiana University, the Digital Methods Specialist for IUâ€™s Institute for Digital Arts and Humanities, and a digital consultant for The American Historical Review. My research interests focus on the cultural economy of the U.S. in the nineteenth and early twentieth century. My dissertation project explores the evolving role of advertising in American society as a window into the development of capitalism in the postbellum period. I am also deeply involved in the digital humanities and incorporate GIS, network analysis, and coding in my work and research projects.
